alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Inland Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong shower will impact portions of northeastern Bay and western Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 130 PM CDT... At 100 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower 15 miles northwest of Stonemill Creek, or 17 miles northeast of Callaway, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Betts, Moose Pond, Center Lake, Youngstown, Fountain, Singer Road, Broad Branch and Saunders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
